members.description:
Constructor. 0xRRGGBB. The default value is 0x000000. For example, .25 sets a transparency value of 25%. the more color is imprinted and the stronger the contrast between the shadow and the background. Valid values are 0 to 255.0.
  • BitmapFilterQuality.LOW
  • BitmapFilterQuality.MEDIUM
  • BitmapFilterQuality.HIGH

For more information about these values, see the quality property description.

an inner shadow. A value of false specifies an outer shadow (a shadow around the outer edges of the object). makes the object's fill transparent and reveals the background color of the document. indicates that the object itself is not drawn; only the shadow is visible.

values: distance Offset distance for the shadow, in pixels.
angle Angle of the shadow, 0 to 360 degrees (floating point).
color Color of the shadow, in hexadecimal format
alpha Alpha transparency value for the shadow color. Valid values are 0.0 to 1.0.
blurX Amount of horizontal blur. Valid values are 0 to 255.0 (floating point).
blurY Amount of vertical blur. Valid values are 0 to 255.0 (floating point).
strength The strength of the imprint or spread. The higher the value,
quality The number of times to apply the filter. Use the BitmapFilterQuality constants:
inner Indicates whether or not the shadow is an inner shadow. A value of true specifies
knockout Applies a knockout effect (true), which effectively
hideObject Indicates whether or not the object is hidden. A value of true

members.description: The alpha transparency value for the color. Valid values are 0 to 1. For example, .25 sets a transparency value of 25%.

The angle of the bevel. Valid values are from 0 to 360Â°. The angle value represents the angle of the theoretical light source falling on the object and determines the placement of the effect relative to the object. If the distance property is set to 0, the effect is not offset from the object and, therefore, the angle property has no effect.
The color of the glow. Valid values are in the hexadecimal format 0xRRGGBB.
The offset distance of the bevel. Valid values are in pixels (floating point).
Indicates whether or not the object is hidden. The value true indicates that the object itself is not drawn; only the shadow is visible. The default is false, meaning that the object is shown.
Specifies whether the glow is an inner glow. The value true indicates an inner glow. The default is false that creates an outer glow (a glow around the outer edges of the object).
Returns a copy of this filter object. properties of the original DropShadowFilter instance.
